alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 3:32AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana, Northern Kentucky and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Dearborn, Ohio, Ripley and Switzerland. In Northern Kentucky, Boone, Campbell and Kenton. In Southwest Ohio, Hamilton. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 330 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms was moving into the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen from previous rainfall yesterday evening. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cincinnati, Covington, Florence, Independence, Norwood, Erlanger, Fort Thomas, Newport, Sharonville, Blue Ash, Loveland, Reading, Montgomery, North College Hill, Madeira, Edgewood, Elsmere, Wyoming, Cheviot and Fort Mitchell.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
